Description: Handle zone sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: from left, narrow vertical band, possibly part of a tendril and incised palmette with added red on heart and alternating petals; to right, draped male (head and back remaining) to right; painted inscription above palmette.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see the band cup 11523 in CVA, Adolphseck Schloss Fasanerie 1, pl. 21, no. 1, no. 3. See also British Museum 1852,0707.15 from Corinth.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 413, no. B635)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0484) (Phase 1)
